understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a private method named journalSerializer() which returns a Serializer object. It checks if the _journalSerializer is not null and returns it, otherwise it creates a new JavaSerializer object.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to configuration as it is responsible for determining the Serializer object to use in the Prevayler creation process. The method checks if a custom Serializer has been set in the _journalSerializer variable, and if not, it falls back to using the default JavaSerializer. This decision on which Serializer to use is crucial for configuring the behavior of the Prevayler system.

config_description: Cannot found this configuration description for this configuration.
developer_understanding_on_working: The _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration is passed as a parameter to the constructor of PrevaylerImpl class when creating a Prevayler instance. It is used to define the transaction deep copy mode for the Prevayler implementation.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration is triggered whenever a new Prevayler instance is created, which typically happens when the create() method is called.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration option on the system depends on the value passed to it. It affects how transactions are handled in terms of deep copying, which can impact memory usage and performance.
